API#

Data#

class cenfind.core.data.Dataset(path: Path)

Represent a Dataset folder.

It is responsible for setting the subdirectories. It also provides a setup method to create the necessary subdirectories.

property fields: List[Field]

Return the list of Fields found in projections. It filters file names that end with .tif and that do not start with a period. It raises a ValueError if there is no file in the directory.

setup() → None

Create the subdirectories inside the Dataset path. It does not overwrite existing subdirectories. For reference, it creates visualisation, statistics, predictions, nuclei, centrioles, cilia and assignment.

class cenfind.core.data.Field(path: Path)

Represent a Field and is responsible to return its name and to load the referenced image.

Param:

path

property data: ndarray

Load the data at path and return it as a numpy array using tifffile.imread

property name: str

Return the field name as a string without the extension

Structures#

These objects are representation of the different organelles to be detected.

class cenfind.core.structures.Centriole(field: Field, channel: int, centre: Tuple[int, int], index: int = 0, label: str = '', parent: Centriole = None)#

Represent a centriole as a 2d point associated with a Field and a channel index.

Detectors#

Extract the nuclei from the field. :param field: :param channel: :param model:

Returns:

List of Contours.

Logging#

Measure#

cenfind.core.measure.flag(is_full: bool) → tuple#

Helper function to change colour of contour. Parameters ———- is_full

Returns#

cenfind.core.measure.signed_distance(focus: Centriole, nucleus: Nucleus) → float#

Wrapper for the opencv PolygonTest

Serialisers#

Statistics#

cenfind.core.statistics.frequency(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame#

Count the absolute frequency of number of centriole per well or per field :param df: Df containing the number of centriole per nuclei :return: Df with absolute frequencies.

Parameters#

scored

Visualisation#

cenfind.core.visualisation.create_vignette(field: Field, marker_index: int, nuclei_index: int) → ndarray#

Normalise all markers and represent them as blue and highlight the channel in green.

cenfind.core.visualisation.draw_foci(image: ndarray, foci: list[Centriole], radius=2) → ndarray#

Draw foci as disks of given radius.

Parameters:

  • image – the channel for the dimension extraction

  • foci – the list of foci

  • radius – the radius of foci

:return the mask with foci

cenfind.core.visualisation.resize_image(image: ndarray, factor: int = 256) → ndarray#

Resize the image for nuclei segmentation by StarDist

Parameters:

  • image – a single channel image (H x W)

  • factor – the target dimension

:return the image resized
